content: sarah youde / a dorky emu let it shine socks - ver 1 0 show off that beautiful yarn with a simple lace panel on a pair of otherwise simple vanilla socks page 1 of 6 sarah youde / a dorky emu let it shine socks - ver 1 0 materials sock yarn fingering weight / 4 ply 2 5mm double pointed needles or 30 circular needle darning needle for sewing in those pesky ends j abbreviations k knit p- purl pm place marker sm slip marker rm remove marker sl1 slip one stitch onto right needle without knitting it ssk slip two stitches knitwise onto right needle and knit them together k2tog knit two stitches together sl1 purlwise slip the stitch onto the right needle putting the right needle through the stitch as if you were going to purl it instructions using a 2 25mm cast on 64 stitches using the long tail cast on method alternatively use your favourite stretchy cast on method note the pattern is written for a 64 stitch sock but it is very easy to convert to a 56 or 72 stitch sock if required to do this you can adjust the placement of the lace panel on the left sock to begin 16 stitches from the end of the first needle join to work in the round cuff work in k2 p2 rib for 16 row page 2 of 6 sarah youde / a dorky emu let it shine socks - ver 1 0 leg begin the pattern please note the pattern is different for the left and right sock so that the lace panel runs down the outside edge of the foot on each sock begin the pattern please note the pattern is different for the left and right sock so that the lace panel runs down the outside edge of the foot on each sock right foot row 1 k7 p1 k1 k2tog yo k1 yo ssk k1 p1 knit to end row 2 k7 p1 k7 p1 knit to end row 3 k7 p1 k2tog yo k3 yo ssk p1 knit to end row 4 as row 2 left foot row 1 k16 p1 k1 k2tog yo k1 yo ssk k1 p1 knit to end row 2 k16 p1 k7 p1 knit to end row 3 k16 p1 k2tog yo k3 yo ssk p1 knit to end row 4 as row 2 repeat these 4 row until the leg is the desired length i did 14 pattern repeats finish following a row 4 page 3 of 6 sarah youde / a dorky emu let it shine socks - ver 1 0 heel turn work sl 1 purl 31 stitches leave the remaining 32 stitches on a spare needle and work the heel back and forth on the 32 stitches you have just worked as follows row 1 sl1 *k1 sl1 repeat from * to last st k1 turn row 2 sl1 purl to end of row turn row 3 sl1
